pull.title: depends: update `LD64_VERSION` to 711
pull.body:
I forgot to do this in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7d5815293ed8a3dea68b61a78944e410f02b147f.
Add a test so it's impossible to forget.

issue.title: build: use macOS 14 SDK (Xcode 15.0)
issue.body:
This fixes: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28349#issuecomment-1748515277 (cross-compiling with C++20 for macOS). Qt doesn't build again the new Xcode, not sure why:
```bash
../../include/QtCore/5.15.10/QtCore/private/../../../../../src/corelib/kernel/qcore_mac_p.h:267:13: error: use of undeclared identifier 'os_activity_scope_enter'; did you mean 'os_activity_scope_state_s'?
            os_activity_scope_enter(static_cast<os_activity_t>(*this), &state);
            ^
/root/bitcoin/depends/SDKs/Xcode-15.0-15A240d-extracted-SDK-with-libcxx-headers/usr/include/os/activity.h:122:16: note: 'os_activity_scope_state_s' declared here
typedef struct os_activity_scope_state_s {
               ^
In file included from time/qtimezoneprivate_mac.mm:44:
In file included from ../../include/QtCore/5.15.10/QtCore/private/qcore_mac_p.h:1:
../../include/QtCore/5.15.10/QtCore/private/../../../../../src/corelib/kernel/qcore_mac_p.h:273:13: error: use of undeclared identifier 'os_activity_scope_leave'
            os_activity_scope_leave(&state);
            ^
../../include/QtCore/5.15.10/QtCore/private/../../../../../src/corelib/kernel/qcore_mac_p.h:304:20: error: use of undeclared identifier '_os_activity_current'; did you mean '_os_activity_start'?
QT_MAC_WEAK_IMPORT(_os_activity_current);
                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                   _os_activity_start
```

I've compiled and tested excluding Qt (with master and #28349), and this is good enough to make C++20 a reality. See https://developer.apple.com/xcode/cpp/#c++20 for C++20 support in Apples libc++, some features landed with Xcode 14.3, although many more landed with Xcode 15.0.
